SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.esri.mo2.file.shp
Class DbfFile

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.file.shp.DbfFile
public class DbfFile
extends Object

This class manages dBase files. Note that all record numbers index from 1.

The following code snippet shows how to create a dbf file using the DbfFile, DbfRecord, and DbfField classes. This example creates a dbf file that contains 9 fields and 20 records.

int i,n; byte byteVal; double doubleVal; float floatVal; int intVal; long longVal,dateVal; short shortVal; boolean logicalVal; String characterVal; DbfField byteField,shortField,integerField,longField; DbfField floatField,doubleField; DbfField logicalField,dateField,characterField; DbfFile dbf; DbfRecord dbfRec; try { dbf= new DbfFile("output.dbf"); dbf.openNew(); n=20; //define fields byteField= DbfField.create("BYTE",Types.TINYINT,2,0); dbf.addField(byteField); shortField= DbfField.create("SHORT",Types.SMALLINT,4,0); dbf.addField(shortField); integerField= DbfField.create("INTEGER",Types.INTEGER,9,0); dbf.addField(integerField); longField= DbfField.create("LONG",Types.BIGINT,18,0); dbf.addField(longField); floatField= DbfField.create("FLOAT",Types.FLOAT,8,1); dbf.addField(floatField); doubleField= DbfField.create("DOUBLE",Types.DOUBLE,17,1); dbf.addField(doubleField); dateField= DbfField.create("DATE",Types.DATE,8,0); dbf.addField(dateField); logicalField= DbfField.create("LOGICAL",Types.BIT,1,0); dbf.addField(logicalField); characterField= DbfField.create("CHARACTER",Types.CHAR,4,0); dbf.addField(characterField); byteVal=(byte)0; shortVal=0; intVal=0; longVal=0; floatVal=(float)0.0; doubleVal=0.0; dateVal=0; logicalVal=true; characterVal=new String(); for (i=1; i<=n; i++) { dbfRec= dbf.createRecord(); dbfRec.setValue(0,new Byte(byteVal)); byteVal++; dbfRec.setValue(1,new Short(shortVal)); shortVal++; dbfRec.setValue(2,new Integer(intVal)); intVal++; dbfRec.setValue(3,new Long(longVal)); longVal++; dbfRec.setValue(4,new Float(floatVal)); floatVal= floatVal + (float)1.0; dbfRec.setValue(5,new Double(doubleVal)); doubleVal= doubleVal + 1.0; dbfRec.setValue(6,new Date(dateVal)); dateVal= dateVal + 86400000; dbfRec.setValue(7,new Boolean(logicalVal)); if (logicalVal) logicalVal=false; else logicalVal=true; characterVal= String.valueOf(i-1); dbfRec.setValue(8,characterVal); dbf.putRecord(dbfRec); if (dbfRec.getStatus()==DbfRecord.OK) System.out.println("Record "+i+" written ok"); else System.out.println("Record "+i+" has error"); } dbf.close(); } catch (Exception e) { System.out.println("exception thrown"); } The following code snippet shows how to read a dbf file using the DbfFile, DbfRecord, and DbfField classes. This example reads and displays all of the fields and values to the system console. int i; int j; int numRecs; int numFields; DbfField[] fields; DbfFile dbf; DbfRecord dbfRec; Object object; try { dbf= new DbfFile("output.dbf"); dbf.openReadOnly(); numFields= dbf.getNumFields(); numRecs= dbf.getNumRecs(); fields= dbf.getFields(); //display field names for (i=0; i<numFields; i++) { System.out.print(fields[i].getName() + "\t"); if (i==6) { //date field is kind of long System.out.print("\t\t"); } } System.out.println(); //display field values for (i=1; i<=numRecs; i++) { dbfRec= dbf.getRecord(null,i); if (dbfRec.getStatus() != DbfRecord.OK) continue; for (j=0; j<numFields; j++) { object= dbfRec.getValue(j); System.out.print(object.toString() + "\t"); } System.out.println(); } dbf.close(); } catch (Exception e) { System.out.println("exception thrown"); }

setFileCodePage

public void setFileCodePage(String codePage)
Sets the code page of the currently open file. This method does not change the value of the languageId.

Parameters:

setCodePage

public void setCodePage(String codePage)
Sets the default code page that will be used when creating a new file. This method does not change the value of the default languageId.

Parameters:
codePage - new codepage

setFileLanguageId

public void setFileLanguageId(int id)
Sets the language Id of the currently open file. This method does not change the value of the java character encoding.

Parameters:
id - new language id

setLanguageId

public void setLanguageId(int id)
Sets the default language Id that will be used when creating a new file. This method does not change the value of the default java character encoding.

Parameters:
id - new language id

isOpen

public boolean isOpen()
Determines if the file is open

Returns:
true if the file is open, false otherwise

delRecord

public int delRecord(int recnum)
Deletes the specified record. This method actually flags the record for deletion by placing an asterisk at the beginning of the record's buffer (per dBASE standards). This method DOES NOT physically remove the record from the file.

Parameters:
recnum - record to be deleted
Returns:
DbfRecord.DELETED if successful, returns DbfRecord.IOERROR otherwise.

getName

Returns the name of the file

Returns:
the file name

findCodePage

public static final String findCodePage(int id)
Returns the codepage name associated with the dbf language id. If the language id is not found in the table, then the current system codepage will be returned.

Parameters:
id - dbf language id
Returns:
the matching codepage if successful, or the current system codepage otherwise

findLanguageId

public static final int findLanguageId(String codePage)
Returns the language id associated with the dbf codepage. If the codepage is not found in the table, the value returned will be zero.

Parameters:
codePage - dbf codepage name
Returns:
the matching language id if successful, zero otherwise

matchLanguageId

public static boolean matchLanguageId(int id)
Determines if the user specified langauge id is found in the codepage tables.

Parameters:
id - dbf language id
Returns:
true if the id is in the table

matchCodePage

public static boolean matchCodePage(String codePage)
Determines if the user specified codepage name is found in the codepage tables.

Parameters:
codePage - codepage name
Returns:
true if the name is in the table

getHeaderInfo

public DbfHeader getHeaderInfo()
                        throws IOException
Returns the header values of the DBF file. This method does not attempt to validate any of the header values. It simply returns the information that it reads.

Returns:
Header values
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

Throws:
